name: Queens Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: I am staying here as a conference delegate, but if I didn't have budget restrictions, I would stay somewhere else. I asked for a quiet room as I understand that many people have said that they have stayed in rooms facing onto a night club and it's very noisy. My room is on the 4th floor and is part of the roof so it's a weird shape. The floor also seems to be at an angle, sloping in different places and has an uneven floor. And even though there is little street noise, as it's breezy the roof slates rattle so it certainly isn't quiet! The room is ok. It could be cleaner- there are roof hairs in the bed, black bacteria around the sink and bath, and the bathroom floor has the same kind of lino that public toilets have on them. The general deco is tired and could do with a kick of paint and thorough clean. As a short person I found it very difficult to climb in and out of the bath to have a shower so if you Gav mobility problems, you have a problem! I paid £75 a night for bed and breakfast. If this is the room rate then for 2 people its good value. If it is per person, I would save your money and stay elsewhere as there is simply no way that it is worth £150 a night. However,this hotel is in a grate location on the seafront minutes walk from the pier, shops and restaurants and the royal pavilion. It needs some TLC, bleach and a kick of paint.
reviews.title: Average hotel in good location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really enjoyed staying in this hotel. The location was great but unfortunately parking locally was expensive. I also didn't appreciate that I had to book for a minimum of 2 nights at the weekend when I only really wanted to stay on Saturday night and this cost me twice the price of staying on Sunday night. But other than that I had a great stay, friendly staff, reasonably priced food to a good standard. I will stay again but I will try and find cheaper parking the next time...
reviews.title: Good Hotel in Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location and we got a large, airy room which if we craned out of the window could just see the pier! Bed was comfy and big, everywhere was clean. There was a complimentary bottle of fizzy water and some custard creams, always a good sign. Breakfast was good, plentiful and hot with a decent selection. Staff were helpful and friendly. There is no car park at this hotel, they will give you a map at reception for two options, we chose the cheaper option £12.50 for 24 hours, it was about a 10 minute walk by the West Pier, carpark was ok but not brilliant but the closer carpark was double the price. There is a loading bay by the hotel but be careful we saw two cars getting ticketted.
reviews.title: Great hotel but don't hold out much hope for the spa!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The spa was a bit of a disappointment, the pool small and one of the ones you have to walk through the gym in your wet swimsuit. Although the steam room was good and a great size.
reviews.title: Great hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: All in all a great hotel would def reccomend.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were originally booked into the Royal Albion just down the road... until I saw the reviews on this website! We quickly cancelled and booked the Queens Hotel instead (which was our original first choice, but more expensive) and we were SO RELIEVED that we did!!
reviews.title: So pleased!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Queens Hotel is modern, funky, comfortable & clean. The bar is fantastic and the Mai Tai cocktail is highly recommended!
reviews.title: Not quite special enough for the money

likes.disliked: — Expensive but didn't make you feel special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were helpful and efficient. Breakfast was great.
reviews.title: Classy and polished

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location could not be any better for both the sea front and the Lanes and bars.
reviews.title: Second time at this hotel. Would defimately recommend it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The bedroom was small but adequate for a weekend break.
reviews.title: A Seafront Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I were actually booked in at the Belgrave, but they were overbooked, so we ended up at the Queens.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Great View!

likes.disliked: — Dirty Windows, Decor could be improved

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Knowing Brighton well, was comfortable with the location of the Hotel, and was pleasantly surprised with the lobby interior.
reviews.title: Tired, shabby, noisy and lacklustre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The receptionist was empathetic and frankly lovely, the rate booked through lastminute.com didn't include breakfast, but we were told at reception that this was included, so that was another pleasant surprise, seeing as Hotels usually charge in excess of £10 per person for this.
reviews.title: Give this hotel a wide berth....

likes.liked: — That we got to leave it after one night.........
likes.disliked: — Too long a list to mention.........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You are also given free use of the Health Club and Swimming Pool facilities, I didn't venture downstairs so I can't comment on that part!
reviews.title: Abysmal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a Superior Double Room which had a huge corridor between the door and the main part of the room. Go for a sea view if you can (although there are a number of bars and clubs in this area of the Sea Front, so if you are staying between Thursday and Sunday you may experience noise).
reviews.title: Lovely for a romantic stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Queens Hotel for one night. We were staying in Brighton because I was running the marathon and this seemed a perfect location for us as it was close to the start and finish. We arrived at midday and asked if our room was ready. The very friendly receptionist had one room available so we were able to check in early which was great. We were given a sea view room on the first floor, when we entered the room we were delighted with the view from the two floor to ceiling windows. The room was clean and well decorated. It does have a worn feel about it but you have to consider that this is an old hotel and the original features have been retained so the result is rather charming. The issues arose when we tried to get to sleep at around 10pm, we had a constant stream of noisy party goers passing our window all night long which meant that we did not get a good night sleep. I realise that Brighton is renowned for it's party scene but this did become tiresome after the first few hours. Also, the mattress wasn't terribly comfortable. There is no parking available at the hotel which is understandable given its proximity to the lanes and the pier. Parking for one day and a half cost £46 in the nearest car park. Would we go back? Probably, as long as sleeping wasn't a priority.
reviews.title: It was great until we needed to get some sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We Stayed at the Queens hotel Easter friday, 4 Girlies on a fun weekend, we had a Family Suite which was top notch with Fantastic Views...The Breakfast was also brilliant & plentiful...We are booking again for next Year! Thanks Queens hotel for looking after us x
reviews.title: Fab Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Queens hotel is a little worn round the edges but on the whole was of an acceptable standard. We had a sea view room which was of a good size, though the bathroom was a bit on the small side. The initial impression of the room was good but the devil is in the detail and it's the detail that let the room down, mostly in the house keeping which needs to be more thorough i.e a few splash marks were left around the basin and down one side of the bed base, one side of the leather covered beverage tray was peeling, the small table between the 2 easy chairs could have done with revarnishing or replacing.
reviews.title: Needs Some TLC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: Leaving these small issues aside, the room was generally clean, the bed comfortable, the towels fluffy enough with a nice big bath towel, plenty of hot water and a reasonable choice of TV channels.
reviews.title: Ok!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Queens is quite an old building so the floors creek and I'm not sure what the guest's were doing in the room above mine but they seemed very "energetic" or perhaps in training for some Olympic event. My room had a connecting door to the next room ( which was locked of course ) but I think the next room must have been a family room as the noise of children laughing and playing was loud enough to wake me at 6:15 am and keep me awake for the next 2 hours.
reviews.title: brighton trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband brought me to the hotel for the weekend to celebrate my birthday. How I wish I'd known where we were going and had a chance to read reviews written about it.
reviews.title: So disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in room 203 - a suite. The bathroom was disgusting, the lock on the door plastic and filthy and towels threadbare. It was a cold weekend and the rooms were freezing. The bed was hard, and the noise of traffic / revellors put an end to any plans for a good rest. In my view, this was a complete waste of money. I wish we'd stayed at home.
reviews.title: Perfect location but rooms really need attention!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is ideal for shopping, going out in the evening, the staff are good and helpful although it is a bit of a struggle with heavy luggage to your room.
reviews.title: up and down hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On first sight of your room it's nice, airy and sea rooms are perfect but you then notice tatty furniture, carpet stains, I had rather unsavoury looking stains up the curtains!
reviews.title: A Bit Of A Mixed Bag!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The bathroom needs updating with lots of stained or rusty metal bathroom furniture.
reviews.title: queens hotel brighton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Me, my wife and a friend decided very last minute to take the train down to Brighton and stay for a night as it was our friend's last few days in the UK for a long time. We went with the aim of doing a bit of shopping, sitting on the beach, going to restaurants etc. The aim here was for a relaxing, refreshing trip. I chose this hotel as it seemed to be the best around that accommodated 3 people in 1 room i.e family suite which can accommodate 5 people and also meant a reasonable rate at 149 a night which meant we only had to pay 50 each.
reviews.title: I regret booking here last minute

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OK so my regret is that I went ahead with booking the room despite trip-advisor reviews with warnings about the night- life noise that went on until about 4.30-5am!!! All of us got about 2-3 hours sleep! There is a nightclub nearby and lots of partyers amble up and down the street behind the hotel all night singing, shouting screaming etc etc. We were really unlucky because it was a warm dry evening and lots of people were in the street dancing and singing with buskers playing guitars. The windows are double glazed but because they are just below you outside, you can hear everything.
reviews.title: Tower Suite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also we were woken by slamming doors/suitcases at around 8am. We were in room 100 which is on the 1st floor and kind of faces away from the sea (although you can see the sea quite easily from the window).
reviews.title: Adequate but a tad overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: So because of the sleep factor, I would never recommend anyone staying here. But that's because this ALONE ruined the trip. It's fair that other travelers understand this when booking here. I give a good rating because of the staff and service we received
reviews.title: The Queens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel and the staff are actually amazing and am really impressed with the service they gave. I list some things here:
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but noisy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As others have mentioned, getting a room for 1 night at the weekends in Brighton can be a nightmare. We ended up paying £140 for the Queen's Hotel simply because it was the only place we could find.
reviews.title: Good compared with others in the area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having had negative experiences of "four star" hotels in Brighton I wasn't expecting much, but I was pleasantly surprised. Check in was efficient and our fourth floor room was spacious, clean and had a lovely bathroom. No minibar and getting an ironing board was a bit of a mission, involving several phonecalls to reception, but staff were friendly and apologetic.
reviews.title: Thank U, Roger!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We didn't have a sea view but that was made clear when booking so no complaints there. The advantage of not being on the front was a quiet room - that coupled with the nice bed made for a good night's sleep.
reviews.title: Wonderful!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was delicious but rather busy and we did have to wait a little while to be seated. I would stay here again, and would recommend it over others in the town.
reviews.title: A great little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at The Queen's Hotel for 4 nights at the end of May. It was the 1st time we had stayed there, but we shall be visiting again soon. We had a glorious seaview room, it's worth paying the extra, just to watch this priceless view.
reviews.title: Great return visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Last Christmas, me and my work lot booked and stayed at The Queens Hotel for what turned out to be a brilliant Christmas party.
reviews.title: a great place for parties!!...or just chilling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed overnight, and although I loved the room and food, the only downside was I hadnt got a seaview (but I guess I should have requested one!!).
reviews.title: Great hotlel, nice location, no parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Anyway, I stayed again for three nights in July, and the hotel again didnt disappoint. New bar, and perhaps breakfast was a rather busy affair, but lovely food & staff. This time I went for a seaview. No iron in room, but within 3 minutes of asking, I got one.
reviews.title: GREAT PRICE, GREAT SERVICE, CANT COMPLAIN!
Ticked all the boxes
reviews.text: Defenitely worth a visit!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Ive read mixed reviews about the Queens....and nearly didnt book it for some of the bad ones I read ......However these folks must have been staying at another Queens.
reviews.title: Mature Girls Weekend

description: At the Queens Hotel in Brighton, you will receive a warm welcome from our friendly and professional team, one which will ensure your stay with us will be a truly memorable experience. The Queens Hotel Brighton overlooks Brighton Beach, the famous Brighton Pier, and promenade. The area comes alive at night with various restaurants, pubs and clubs situated around the area. The hotel has a large leisure club with Pool, Sauna & steam room as well as 20 cardiovascular & 10 resistance machine as well as a well stocked free weights area & Olympic bench. We also have an in-house spa offering a wide range of beauty treatments & the No1 Bar and Bistro for Breakfast, Afternoon Teas and Evening meals & snacks with our Bar open till 1am Sunday – Thursday, & 3AM Friday and Saturdays.
